intro: Maughania yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan maughania, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
